snippet: Rather than hunker down in negotiations as he did in 2011, aides said, the president will try to rally the public for an accord that could set the tone for his second term.
abstract: Washington Memo; Pres Obama, emboldened by his re-election and lessons of four years in office, sees renewed budget talks with Republicans as a second chance to take command of national policy debates and finally fulfill his promise to end Washington gridlock; aides say Obama will travel beyond the Beltway to rally public support for a deficit-cutting accord that mixes tax increase for the wealthy with spending cuts.
lead_paragraph: Rather than hunker down in negotiations as he did in 2011, aides said, the president will try to rally the public for an accord that could set the tone for his second term.

headline.seo: Legacy at Stake, Obama Plans Broader Push for Budget Deal
headline.main: In Debt Talks, Obama Is Ready to Go Beyond Beltway
headline.print_headline: In Debt Talks, Revived Obama Is Ready to Go Beyond Beltway
